Package fr.insalyon.messenger.net.multicastclient

Class MulticastClient

  • java.lang.Object
    • fr.insalyon.messenger.net.multicastclient.MulticastClient
  • public class MulticastClient
extends java.lang.Object
    This class allows users to interact with other users by connecting to a group with a multicast based on socket UDP method

      void listenerThread()
      Allows interpreting udp messages received by the client that have been sent in the mutlicast group Allows to recover the different data received and to assign the appropriate application processing to make them interpretable by the user of the application The data will be stored in the various attributes provided for this purpose of the current client

      Allows sending hello in the group to warn of our precariousness with an udp packet
      void senderThread()
      Allows you to send different types of events to the multicast group depending on the user's interaction with the application and its purpose Allows displaying data by the user in the terminal This thread is only used with the terminal interface by reading the System.in messages

      Allows sending in the group a message with an udp packet

        public MulticastClient​(java.lang.String username,
                       boolean isTerminal)
                throws java.io.IOException
        Constructor to create a mutlicast client
        Parameters:
        username - the client name
        isTerminal - true if it is a terminal application
        appState - defines if it is a Kotlin application
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - Error of connection

    • Method Detail

      • connect

        public void connect​(java.lang.String ip,
                    int port)
             throws java.io.IOException
        Allows to connect into a group chat defines with the ip
        Parameters:
        ip - the ip of the group
        port - the port we want to use
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - Error of connection

      • disconnect

        public void disconnect()
                throws java.io.IOException
        Allows disconnecting from a group
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - disconnection error

      • main

        public static void main​(java.lang.String[] args)
                 throws java.io.IOException
        Allows to launch the terminal application
        Parameters:
        args -
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - Error of format and connection

      • listenerThread

        public void listenerThread()
        Allows interpreting udp messages received by the client that have been sent in the mutlicast group Allows to recover the different data received and to assign the appropriate application processing to make them interpretable by the user of the application The data will be stored in the various attributes provided for this purpose of the current client

      • isDesktopActive

        private boolean isDesktopActive()
        Allows to now the type of the app used
        Returns:
        true if the app used is the kotlin app

      • senderThread

        public void senderThread()
        Allows you to send different types of events to the multicast group depending on the user's interaction with the application and its purpose Allows displaying data by the user in the terminal This thread is only used with the terminal interface by reading the System.in messages

      • displayUsersInChat

        private void displayUsersInChat()
        Allows displaying in the terminal users connected in the current group

      • messageReceived

        public void messageReceived​(java.lang.String message)
        Event triggered on message received Used in the listening thread
        Parameters:
        message - the message to display

      • sendMessage

        public void sendMessage​(java.lang.String message)
                 throws java.io.IOException
        Allows sending in the group a message with an udp packet
        Parameters:
        message - the message to send
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - Packet error

      • sayHello

        public void sayHello​(java.lang.String destination)
              throws java.io.IOException
        Allows sending hello in the group to warn of our precariousness with an udp packet
        Parameters:
        destination - the destination is a specific user or the group chat
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - Packet error

        private void sayGoodBye()
